capsules.title: Trading Fundamentals
capsules.subject: Trading
capsules.description: Basic concepts of financial trading and investment
notes: Bull Market: Rising prices and optimistic sentiment
Bear Market: Falling prices and pessimistic sentiment
Support Level: Price level where buying interest emerges
Resistance Level: Price level where selling pressure appears
Volume: Number of shares traded in a given period
Market Cap: Total value of company shares
P/E Ratio: Price-to-Earnings ratio for valuation
Dividend: Payment made by companies to shareholders

flashcards.back: A market with rising prices and optimistic investor sentiment
A market with falling prices and pessimistic investor sentiment
A price level where buying interest typically emerges
A price level where selling pressure typically appears
The number of shares traded in a given time period
The total value of all company shares outstanding
Price-to-Earnings ratio used for stock valuation
A payment made by companies to their shareholders

quiz.question: What characterizes a Bull Market?
quiz.explanation: A Bull Market is characterized by rising prices and optimistic sentiment

quiz.question: What is the main purpose of a Stop Loss order?
quiz.explanation: Stop Loss orders are designed to limit potential losses on a trade

quiz.question: What does high trading volume typically indicate?
quiz.explanation: High volume indicates strong interest and participation in the market

quiz.question: What is diversification in trading?
quiz.explanation: Diversification means spreading investments across different assets to reduce risk

capsules.title: JavaScript Fundamentals
capsules.subject: Programming
notes: Variables are containers for storing data values
Functions are reusable blocks of code
Arrays store multiple values in a single variable
Objects are collections of key-value pairs

flashcards.front: What is a variable in JavaScript?
flashcards.back: A container for storing data values

flashcards.front: How do you declare a function?
flashcards.back: function functionName() { }
A data structure that stores multiple values
JavaScript Object Notation - a data interchange format

quiz.question: Which keyword is used to declare a variable in JavaScript?
quiz.explanation: var, let, and const are all used to declare variables

quiz.question: What does DOM stand for?
quiz.explanation: DOM represents the structure of HTML documents

flashcards.back: Hola
Gracias
Por favor
Adiós
¿Cómo estás?

quiz.question: How do you say "Thank you" in Spanish?
quiz.explanation: Gracias is the most common way to say thank you

capsules.title: World Capitals
capsules.subject: Geography
capsules.description: Capital cities of countries around the world

flashcards.back: Paris
Tokyo
Brasília
Canberra
Cairo

quiz.question: What is the capital of Canada?
quiz.explanation: Ottawa is the capital city of Canada

quiz.question: Which city is the capital of India?
quiz.explanation: New Delhi is the capital of India
